column1: #Text=The polycrystalline material was synthesized by solid-state reaction technique in programmable high-temperature resistive heating furnace.
#Text=The chemicals MgO, Na2CO3, ZnO and B2O3 of 99.99% purity with appropriate amount were crushed with the help of mortar and pestle to make the homogeneous mixture.
#Text=Then the homogeneous mixture was transferred to a platinum crucible and kept it in muffle furnace.
#Text=Initially, the prepared material was heated at 450 oC for 6 h to make the mixture miscible.
#Text=The mixture was further heated at 850 oC continuously for 10 h to decompose B2O3.
#Text=The temperature was then increased up to 1000 °C to melt a charge and maintained constant for another 24 h.
#Text=After that, muffle furnace was turned towards slow cooling with a rate of 3 oC/h to reach 650 oC and finally cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10 oC/h.
#Text=As the MNZB compound decomposes at high temperatures, the reaction temperature was carefully controlled.
#Text=A polycrystalline material and few crystals were obtained and used for further study.
